ukf_voss module¶

Voss’s implementation of the unscented Kalman filter

class ukf_voss.FNModel(a=0.7, b=0.8, c=3.0, Q_par=0.015, Q_var=array([1.]), R=1.0)¶

Bases: UKFModel

The FNModel class is used to represent a FitzHugh-Nagumo model. It inherits from the UKFModel class.

Methods:¶

__init__(self, a=0.7, b=0.8, c=3., Q_par=0.015, Q_var=np.array((1.,)), R=1.)

Initializes an instance of the FNModel class.

f_model(self, x, p)

Takes two parameters, x and p, which are arrays. It computes and returns a 2D array of values based on the given formulas.

obs_g_model(self, x)

Takes a 2D array representing the input data and returns a 1D array representing the observations (in this case the membrane potential variables).

n_params(self)

Returns the number of parameters.

n_variables(self)

Returns the number of variables.

n_observables(self)

Returns the number of observables.

f_model(x, p)¶
Parameters:

  • x – the input array

  • p – the input array

Returns:

a 2D array containing computed values based on the input arrays

This method takes in two parameters, x and p, which are arrays. It computes and returns a 2D array of values based on the given formulas.

The parameter x represents an input array. The parameter p represents an input array.

The return value is a 2D array containing computed values based on the input arrays x and p.

n_observables()¶

Returns the number of observables.

Returns:

Number of observables.

Return type:

int

n_params()¶

Returns the number of parameters.

Returns:

The number of parameters.

Return type:

int

n_variables()¶

Returns the number of variables.

Returns:

The number of variables defined in the method.

Return type:

int

obs_g_model(x)¶
Parameters:

x – A 2-dimensional array representing the input data. The array should have shape (n, m), where n is the number of samples and m is the number of features.

Returns:

A 1-dimensional array representing the observations (in this case the membrane potential variables). The arra

y will have shape (m,) where m is the number of features.

class ukf_voss.FNNature(ll, dT, dt, a=0.7, b=0.8, c=3.0, R0=0.2, initial_condition: ndarray | None = None)¶

Bases: NatureSystem

The FNNature class represents a nature for the FitzHugh-Nagumo model. It inherits from the NatureSystem class.

Attributes:

a (float): Parameter ‘a’ for the FNNature model. b (float): Parameter ‘b’ for the FNNature model. c (float): Parameter ‘c’ for the FNNature model. R0 (float): Initial value of R for the FNNature model. R (float): Current value of R for the FNNature model. x0 (ndarray): The state vector of the nature system. y (ndarray): The observed states of the nature system. p (ndarray): The set of parameters for the nature system.

Methods:
system(self, x, p): Calculates the new state of the system based on the current state ‘x’ and

parameter ‘p’.

set_current(self): Calculates and sets the current ‘p’ in the p array for each step. observations(self): Generates the observations based on the current state and noise.

observations()¶

Calculates the observations based on the system’s state and noise.

Returns:

None

set_current()¶

Sets the current value in the self.p array.

Returns:

None

system(x, p)¶
class ukf_voss.NatureSystem(ll, dT, dt, n_variables, n_params, n_observations, initial_condition=None)¶

Bases: object

integrateRK4()¶

Integrates the system of ordinary differential equations using the fourth order Runge-Kutta method.

Returns:

None

class ukf_voss.UKFModel¶

Bases: object

A class representing a model for a Unscented Kalman Filter.

Attributes:

Q_par (float): Initial value for parameter covariance. Q_var (float): Initial value for variable covariance. R (ndarray): Observation covariance.

f_model(x, p)¶
n_observables()¶
n_params()¶
n_variables()¶
obs_g_model(x)¶
class ukf_voss.UKFVoss(model: UKFModel, ll=800, dT=0.2, dt=0.02)¶

Bases: object

covariance_postprocessing(P)¶

Perform post-processing on the covariance matrix P, to enable for example covariance inflation.

Parameters:

P – The original covariance matrix.

Returns:

The processed covariance matrix P_out.

evolve_f(x)¶

Evolve the given system using a 4th order Runge-Kutta integrator.

Parameters:

x – The initial state of the system. Contains in the first self.dq elements the parameters.

Dynamical variables are the further elements (numpy.ndarray) :return: The evolved state of the system. (numpy.ndarray)

filter(y, initial_condition=None)¶
Parameters:

  • y – The observed data, an array of shape (dy, ll), where dy is the number of observed variables and ll is the number of time steps.

  • initial_condition – The initial condition for the estimation, an array of shape (dx,), where dx is the number of state variables. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Tuple containing the estimated state trajectory x_hat, the covariance matrix Pxx, the Kalman gains Ks, and the estimation errors. All of them are arrays of shape (dx, ll), where dx is the number of state variables and ll is the number of time steps.

stats()¶
stats(self)¶

This method calculates the square root of diagonal elements of a matrix and stores it in an array.

Returns:

A 2-dimensional NumPy array containing the computed square roots of diagonal elements.

unscented_transform(x_hat, Pxx, y, R)¶

This method performs an unscented transform for a given set of parameters.

Parameters:

  • x_hat – Initial state estimate

  • Pxx – Covariance matrix of the state estimate

  • y – Measurement vector

  • R – Measurement noise covariance matrix

Returns:

Updated state estimate, updated covariance matrix, Kalman gain
